page.title: 01 CALNE - NORTH WEST AREA
page.content: Our block is mainly a farming area on the edge of Calne. This area of Calne is mainly a housing estate. There are many gardens and lots of grass.{The {Abberd Brook runs through the estate {and joins the River Marden at Doctor's {Pond. This is where Joseph Priestley {is said to have discovered oxygen.}Our school is named after him. There is also a growing industrial estate with new roads and factories being built. Most of the area is farmland. It is mainly arable with some dairying too. There are sandpits in our block and the gravel lorries drive through the estate with the sand. The village of Compton Bassett is on the edge of our block. About 300 people live there in old cottages. Most of the people who live there are quite old and have lived there all their lives.{
